title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited in this Act, which sets a standard for hospital lengths of stay in group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" mandates that group health plans provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician in consultation with the patient. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" prohibits health plans from avoiding minimum coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the act, incentivizing shorter inpatient stays, or requiring preauthorization for length of stay determination. An appeals process and penalties are outlined by the Secretary. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" prohibits health plans from avoiding coverage requirements, penalizing providers, incentivizing shorter stays, and requiring preauthorization for stay length determination. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalties for violators.
